Professional Summary
Technical Support Analyst with technical and troubleshooting repair expertise.
Team player who is flexible, reliable and adaptable to dynamic environments.

and familiarize skill sets towards core technologies based on enthusiasm,
dedication, and motivation ·Knowledgeable with

Vista, 7, and 8) ·Experienced with the
installation and configuration of Ubuntu Linux whilst cognizant of Mac OS X
interactions ·Proficient with
virtualization and highly skilled with configurations inside of VMware ·Skilled with
troubleshooting hardware and software issues within a network and support
services environment ·Able to document,
effectively communicate, and succeed within a group setting in order to become
a superior team player Willing to work
individually whilst prioritizing tasks or projects and completing assignments based
on expected deadlines

<JD_START>
Job Title: Unified Communication Specialist

Location: Columbus, OH

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Zachary Piper Solutions is seeking several Unified Communications (UC) Engineers to join a long term DoD program contract job opportunity supporting Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) in the following locations:

San Antonio, TXColumbus, OHOgden, UTO'Fallon, IL

Fully-funded through 2027, The UC Engineer will assist with NOC Support of worldwide video and voice services. These on-site positions require an active SECRET clearance. 

Responsibilities for the UC Engineer include:

Perform network and telecommunications system incident investigation.Oversee DoD-wide voice/video support hardware and services (legacy and current offerings): Voice telephony switching on Unclassified and Classified networks, mobile flyaway kits, Voice Internet Service Provider (VISP), and Video Teleconferencing (VTC) systems.Maintain, troubleshoot, document and repair network devices to include phone systems, call managers, VTC’s, network infrastructure and trunk circuits.

Required Qualifications for the UC Engineer include:

2+ years of experience with Information Technology focused on networkingProficiency in TDM telephone switches, VoIP, Call Manager, or VTC systemsHands on experience with CISCO, Juniper, Nortel, ACME Packet, Oracle, Palo Alto, Session Boarder Controllers (SBC), or H.323 endpoints.Ability to perform troubleshooting, configuration, and restoration of services across multiple platforms.General understanding of IP and transport network topologiesIAT Level II Certification (Security+ CE, or equivalent)Active Secret Clearance

Compensation for the UC Engineer include:

 Salary Range: $110,000-135,000 **depending on experience** Full Standard Benefits: PTO, Paid Holidays, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, etc.
